qoute: How use doth breed a habit in man!
Character is simply habit long continued.
A single bad habit will mar an otherwise faultless character, as an ink-drop soileth the pure white page.
The regularity of a habit is generally in proportion to its absurdity.
All human actions have one or more of these seven causes: chance, nature, compulsions, habit, reason, passion, desire.
Creativity can solve almost any problem. The creative act, the defeat of habit by orginality, overcomes everything.
Habit is second nature.
A long habit of not thinking a thing wrong, gives it a superficial appearance of being right
A nail is driven out by another nail. Habit is overcome by habit.
A bad habit never disappears miraculously; it's an undo-it-yourself project.
How use doth breed a habit in man!
Character is simply habit long continued.
A single bad habit will mar an otherwise faultless character, as an ink-drop soileth the pure white page.
The regularity of a habit is generally in proportion to its absurdity.
All human actions have one or more of these seven causes: chance, nature, compulsions, habit, reason, passion, desire.
Creativity can solve almost any problem. The creative act, the defeat of habit by orginality, overcomes everything.
Habit is second nature.
A long habit of not thinking a thing wrong, gives it a superficial appearance of being right
A nail is driven out by another nail. Habit is overcome by habit.
A bad habit never disappears miraculously; it's an undo-it-yourself project.
A habit cannot be tossed out the window; it must be coaxed down the stairs a step at a time.
Chaos often breeds life, when order breeds habit.
Choose the life that is most useful, and habit will make it the most agreeable.
Cocaine isn't habit forming. I should know — I've been using it for years.
Competition is a process or variety of habitual behavior that grows out of a habit of mind.
Culture is the habit of being pleased with the best and knowing why.
Democratic societies are unfit for the publication of such thunderous revelations as I am in the habit of making.
Each year one vicious habit discarded, in time might make the worst of us good.
Every once in a while someone without a single bad habit gets caught.
Excess on occasion is exhilarating. It prevents moderation from acquiring the deadening effect of a habit.
Get the habit of analysis - analysis will in time enable synthesis to become your habit of mind.
Great is the power of habit. It teaches us to bear fatigue and to despise wounds and pain.
Growing old is no more than a bad habit which a busy man has no time to form.
Growing old is no more than a bad habit which a busy man has no time to form.
Habit converts luxurious enjoyments into dull and daily necessities.
Habit is a cable; we weave a thread of it each day, and at last we cannot break it.
Habit is a form of exercise
Habit is a great deadener.
Habit is a shackle for the free.
Habit is either the best of servants or the worst of masters.
Habit is habit, and not to be flung out of the window by any man, but coaxed downstairs a step at a time.
Habit is stronger than reason.
Habit is ten times nature.
Habit is the second nature which destroys the first.
Habit with him was all the test of truth, it must be right: I've done it from my youth.
Habit with it's iron sinews, clasps us and leads us day by day.
Habit, if not resisted, soon becomes necessity.
Habit, my friend, is practice long pursued, that at last becomes man himself.
I never guess. It is a shocking habit - destructive to the logical faculty.
If you do not wish to be prone to anger, do not feed the habit; give it nothing which may tend to its increase.
It is easy to perform a good action, but not easy to acquire a settled habit of performing such actions.
Laziness is nothing more than the habit of resting before you get tired.
Liberty is not merely a privilege to be conferred; it is a habit to be acquired.
Life - how curious is that habit that makes us think it is not here, but elsewhere.
Life never becomes a habit to me. It's always a marvel.
Love is an act of endless forgiveness, a tender look which becomes a habit.
Make a habit of dominating the listening, and let the prospect dominate the talking.
Man has an incurable habit of not fulfilling the prophecies of his fellow men.
Marriage is a very good thing, but I think it's a mistake to make a habit out of it.
Never permit failure to become a habit.
Ninety-nine percent of the failures come from people who have the habit of making excuses.
Not choice but habit rules the unreflecting herd.
Nothing is more powerful than custom or habit.
Once you get into the habit of work, you can be more productive in the things you want to do.
Once you learn to quit, it becomes a habit.
Practice conquers the habit of doing, without reflecting on the rule.
Rigid, the skeleton of habit alone upholds the human frame.
The chains of habit are generally too week to be felt, until they are too strong to be broken.
The habit of common and continuous speech is a symptom of mental deficiency.
The habit of courtesy, when once acquired, is almost impossible to get rid of.
The habit of looking on the best side of every event is worth more than a thousand pounds a years.
The masses have no habit of self reliance or original action.
The world has the habit of making room for the man whose actions show that he knows where he is going.
The world has the habit of making room for the man whose actions show that he knows where he is going.
To change a habit, make a conscious decision, then act out the new behavior.
To exist is a habit I do not despair of acquiring.
To fall into a habit is to begin to cease to be.
True realism consists in revealing the surprising things which habit keeps covered and prevents us from seeing.
We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
We in America have everything we need except the most important thing of all-time to think and the habit of thought.
When one begins to live by habit and by quotation, one has begun to stop living.
Whenever you are angry, be assured that it is not only a present evil, but that you have increased a habit.
Winners have simply formed the habit of doing things losers don't like to do.
Winners make a habit of manufacturing their own positive expectations in advance of the event.
Winning is a habit. Unfortunately, so is losing.
You need to play with supreme confidence, or else you'll lose again, and then losing becomes a habit.
